instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message:
Checked if SMC_RESET_L is present and it is. PP3v42_G3H is also present
I reflowed the SMC, no change

I'm guessing this is definitely an SMC replacement isnt it?

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message: probably important to mention that the board is pristine. No sign of liquid damage

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H exact voltage?
Is it stable?
Also check if SMC_RESET_L is stable high.
Did you try known good DCIN board?

Try to start in SMC bypass mode.
Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS?

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message: Check R7005 and R7020...

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message:
revisiting this now, just received donor boards for it jsut in case. 

PPBUS_g3H is 12.56v and stable
SMC reset is 3.37v stable
Does nothing on SMC bypass, no fan spin. 
checked with two other DC in boards as well
3v3_S5 available 


I replaced ISL and now I always get green light, no more fading

Could it be a fake charger that caused this? perhaps sending 18v somewhere it shouldnt have?

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message:
You should get orange light, even without battery.
Is it original Magsafe 2 60/85W?

What about 3V3_SUS, PM_RSMRST_L, PM_PWRBTN_L, PM_BATLOW_L?

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message:
sorry i totally meant orange light. It's got orange light. yes to the magsafe. 

3v3_SUS is present
PM_RSMRST_L = 3.3
PM_PWRBTN_L = 3.3
PM_BATLOW_L = 3.3

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message: Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for reaction (drop pulse) at PM_PWRBTN_L.

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message: Ok so triggering SMC_ONOFF_L drops the voltage to 0.4 or even less initially. however it doesn't do it again until i have the machine off the charger for a bit and then start again. Bascially only does it once after plugging in charger

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message: actually im wrong, it does it repeatedly, it's just hard to catch. drops down to almost 0

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message: hmmmm now PM_PWRBTN_L is stuck on 1v continiously

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message: after triggering SMC it's back to 3v3 on PM_PWRBTN_L. and drops every time i trigger smc like clockwork

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message: sometimes PM_PWRBTN_L gets stuck low continiously

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message: If PM_PWRBTN_L reacts, then check for pulse (at same time) at all PM_SLP_Sx_L signals.

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message:
PM_SLP_S0 starts low, when triggered goes 3.3v
PM_SLP_S3 starts low, when triggered goes 3.3v
PM_SLP_S4 starts low, when triggered goes over 2v
PM_SLP_S5 starts low, when triggered goes over to 3.3v

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message:
Then all S3/0 voltages should pulse too, check that.
ALL_SYS_PWRGD pulses?
Did you try SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message:
ALL_SYS_PWRGD pulses yes
SMC bypass does nothing. it's as if i'm not even doing it. Usually the light stays off when holding down power button but the light turns on as if i wasnt pressing it.

Also jsut replaced the SMC (i was feeling lucky) and has the exact same symtoms as before
tested S3 and s0 lines and all pulse too

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message:
Did you try BIOS?
Check if pins 7 & 3 of U1950 pulse too.

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message:
7 & 3 of U1950 pulse too
Can i try a new bios without transferring programming just to see if it works? I don't curtrently have a programmer

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message:
Be sure is known good working BIOS.
No need to fix it, as is just for test.

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message: BIOS tested and no difference. is there anything else I can do?

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message: Just checking if there's anything else I could test on this or is this a rabbit hole? thank you!

threads.title: 820-4924 temporary green light then fades. no fan spin
threads.message: Check for short, or very low value to ground, on audio filter caps from 5V power rail.
